channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: Oilers play the Blackhawks after Nurse's 2-goal showing
item.description: The Edmonton Oilers host the Chicago Blackhawks after Darnell Nurse's two-goal game against the New York Rangers in the Oilers' 4-3 overtime loss. Story Chicago Blackhawks (5-4-2, in the Central Division) vs. Edmonton Oilers (5-4-3, in the Pacific Division) Edmonton, Alberta; Saturday, 9 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Blue Jays' Max Scherzer gets second World Series Game 7 start after Dodgers force winner-take-all
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Max Scherzer is about to become the only living pitcher to start two winner-take-all Game 7s in the World Series.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Dodgers stave off elimination to set up winner-take-all World Series Game 7
item.description: Tyler Glasnow's clutch relief outing and Mookie Betts' two-RBI night helped the Dodgers stave off elimination and set up a winner-take-all Game 7 against the Blue Jays.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts says Shohei Ohtani a possibility to start Game 7 of World Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Shohei Ohtani might start Game 7 of the World Series on Saturday. Tyler Glasnow might pitch on back-to-back days. For Los Angeles Dodgers manager Dave Roberts, the only certainty is that Yoshinobu Yamamoto won't pitch. Besides that? "Everyone will be available," Roberts said.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps: 'We are trying our hardest' to settle antitrust lawsuit
item.description: NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps says the organization is working hard to settle a federal antitrust lawsuit with 23XI Racing and Front Row Motorsports.
item.dc:creator: Jenna Fryer, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Police investigating break-in at home reported to belong to NBA star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
item.description: Police on Friday were investigating a burglary at a home reported to belong to the Oklahoma City Thunder’s Shai Gilgeous-Alexander that happened while the NBA's reigning MVP was playing a game the night before.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Australian teen cricketer dies after ball strikes neck during training session
item.description: Australian cricketer Ben Austin, 17, died after being struck by a ball during practice in Melbourne. The cricket community mourns the loss of the young athlete.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Jaguars place two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve with a right knee injury
item.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) — The Jacksonville Jaguars placed two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve Friday because of a knee injury. Coach Liam Coen announced the move a day after Hunter injured his right knee in practice.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Miami Dolphins and General Manager Chris Grier agree to part ways
item.description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. (AP) — The Miami Dolphins and Chris Grier have agreed to part ways, ending his 10-year tenure as general manager. The decision comes after Miami fell to 2-7 on the season following Thursday night’s 28-6 rout against the Baltimore Ravens.
item.dc:creator: ALANIS THAMES, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Blue Jays 1 win away from ending 32-year World Series championship drought
item.description: The Toronto Blue Jays are one win away from capturing their first World Series title in 32 years and will take on the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 6 of the Fall Classic on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Former NFL center Nick Mangold dies shortly after sharing he needed kidney transplant
item.description: His death comes less than two weeks after the two-time All-Pro selection announced on social media that he had kidney disease and needed a transplant.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Kucherov gets 1,000th career point in Lightning's game against Ducks
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — Nikita Kucherov became the third-fastest active player to reach the 1,000-point club, reaching the milestone Saturday in the Tampa Bay Lightning's 4-3 win against the Anaheim Ducks. Kucherov finished with two assists and reached milestone in his 809th career game.
item.dc:creator: ERIK ERLENDSSON, Associated Press, Fox 5
